column4: is https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SmartBootManagerHowto   what you're looking for ?  ("I can not boot from my CD-ROM drive but I can read from it")
mayhaps... i shal check it out
errg..."404 not found" when i click the d/l -. -;
so the link [https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SmartBootManagerHowto ] is what im looking for but this comp im on allready runs ubuntu, are there linux unstructions? i dont own windows XD
dd if=theimage of=/dev/yourfloppy  (I don't know what devices floppies are, and you really, really want to doublecheck it before you splat data across it)
I can't stress the doublecheck bit enough.  I've written a 1.44Mb image over the front of a harddrive before.  it made me cry.
ouch, it wasnt your main hdd was it?
eek, that had to hurt[i think i would cry too, given 60 gigs of video and 20 of games, 7 of music], BTW, how do i find the device path for my floppy?
I'm pretty sure it's /dev/fd* ... my favourite is to put a floppy in, then file -s /dev/thatdevice and see if the floppy starts making fun noises.  it's harmless if it's wrong.
I impress myself.  I haven't had a floppy drive since 1998 :)
[strangly my floppy disk drive is about 10 years old and it still works great, dead silent too]
it was never the drives that irked me.  it was finding doghair inside any disk that held valuable data

lol, i have cats but that was living with my parents, i moved out last year and live with my grandfather now, no pets here[no fuzzy kitties but there i had no awesome computer to learn from and give me a career, lol], anyways, thanks for the help, ill give my new disk a try and let you know if it worked
